Amicus Curiae Briefs: 2.    Brief, MOTION OF AMERICAN PLANNING ASSOCIATION FOR LEAVE TO FILE BRIEF AMICUS CURIAE AND BRIEF AMICUS CURIAE IN SUPPORT OF NEITHER PARTY American Planning Association ("amicus") hereby moves for leave to file a brief amicus curiae because: (1) it is late and (2) consent to file this amicus curiae brief has not been provided by the City of Cuyahoga Falls, Petitioners. A copy of the proposed brief is attached. Amicus was unable to file this brief within the applicable time period due to the numerous consultations it had with other amici filing in their matter. As more fully explained in the brief under "Interest of Amicus Curiae", amicus American Planning Association is a nonprofit organization that represents practicing planners, officials, and citizens involved in fair housing issues, among others. The American Planning Association wishes to concur with the argument advanced by Amici National Fair Housing Alliance and AARP in Part III of their brief concerning the disparate impact test. Accordingly, the American Planning Association respectfully requests that the Court grant leave to file the attached brief amicus curiae. Respectfully submitted, DANIEL R. Ct. Briefs LEXIS 677
